body: Is anyone still working on it?
@metrofun Not that I am aware of, but was going to look into this. Feel free to work on this ticket (if you do, let me know, so we aren't both working on the same thing)

Hi everyone! :wave: :wave:  I'm working on a chart and a PR for this. Currently I have a Helm chart for MLFlow Tracking and have adapted the wine quality prediction ElasticNet Python example to run the training/test run in a pod, log the run to the tracking server pod created by the chart, and verify that the results are present in the tracking store. This is currently tested with two storage backends: the default (which is a PersistentVolume mounted on the pod's filesystem) and Postgres (which is either a pod created by the chart itself or an existing Postgres DB).

I will next work on replicating this test with the R version of the ElasticNet model example, then I'll create charts for MLFlow Models and MLFlow Experiments. Once those are tested, I can submit them as a PR for the official Helm charts.

Please let me know if you have any questions, or if you'd be interested in testing the chart on your cluster. It'd be very helpful to verify that it works in other deployments, as well as to get some feedback on the design of the charts to ensure they cover the requirements you're talking about.

@bali0019 @metrofun
Awesome @afoltzm, we are willing to help/test your charts. We were planning to create our own since we couldn't find any existing ones.
@afoltzm sweet, thanks for working on this. Let me know when you have a PR.
I'm building a Docker file for just `mlflow server` so my team can share experiment results. I don't think I'd want this mixed in with anything else... would i?

@bali0019 I had one question on the intended use case for helm with MLFlow Projects. At first glance, it seems like `kubectl run` is more appropriate for running individual MLFlow projects - they don't get "installed" but rather instead just run on the cluster with the appropriate resources and then terminate. I don't quite see how `helm install` makes sense here. Could you elaborate on what you meant when you suggested a Helm sub-chart for the Projects capability?
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
@afoltzm Do you have the helm charts to deploy mlflow? I am working on something like that. So it could be helpful if you can update it. Thanks.
Thank you for interacting with this issue! Removing the stale label!
